co.cask.cdap.internal.io

Class ReflectionSchemaGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.internal.io.AbstractSchemaGenerator
      • co.cask.cdap.internal.io.ReflectionSchemaGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SchemaGenerator

    public final class ReflectionSchemaGenerator
extends AbstractSchemaGenerator
    This class uses Java Reflection to inspect fields in any Java class to generate RECORD schema.

    If the given type is a class, it will uses the class fields (includes all the fields in parent classes) to generate the schema. All fields, no matter what access it is would be included, except transient or synthetic one.

    If the given type is an interface, it will uses all getter methods (methods that prefix with "get" or "is", followed by a name with no arguments) to generate fields for the record schema. E.g. for the method String getFirstName(), a field name "firstName" of type String would be generated.

        protected Schema generateRecord(com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken<?> typeToken,
                    Set<String> knowRecords,
                    boolean acceptRecursion)
                         throws UnsupportedTypeException
        Description copied from class: AbstractSchemaGenerator
        Generates a RECORD schema of the given type.
        Specified by:
        generateRecord in class AbstractSchemaGenerator
        Parameters:
        typeToken - Type of the record.
        knowRecords - Set of record names that schema has already been generated.
        acceptRecursion - Whether to tolerate type recursion. If false, will throw UnsupportedTypeException if a recursive type is encountered.
        Returns:
        An instance of Schema
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException
